title: Hottest Happy Hour Specials in Chicago
text:

One of the most frequently asked questions I've gotten from visitors--and many locals too--is: "Where are the happy hour specials in Chicago?" For years I've had to shake my head and reply: "There hasn't been anything like that in Illinois since the late 1980s. It's illegal." 
Well, now that the ban has been lifted throughout the state , imbibers may lift their glasses again in a toast to treating themselves to deals. With the Culinary and Hospitality Modernization Act , establishments can offer specials for a maximum of four hours a day, as long as the bars and restaurants promote the discounts at least a week in advance. 
It's no surprise that most Chicago venues will jump aboard in an effort to increase business, but most customers don't want to hit up just any old bar. So, we've narrowed the list to several hot spots offering quality at a discount, from local craft beer offerings to mixology -focused favorites showcasing fresh ingredients. Photo courtesy of The Betty • The Betty 
Sleek and alluring, The Betty is typically an evening destination in the Fulton Market District. But its new happy hour specials should attract a healthy after-work crowd. Seven days a week from 4 to 6 p.m. will feature half off on beers, $8 featured wines and $9 featured classic cocktails, showcasing a different spirit each week. The restaurant has also added a “snack menu," complementing these offerings. It will change seasonally and be updated frequently. 
Address: 839 W. Fulton Market
